column4: Hello! Someone knows how i can fix this? jan@ubuntu:~$ debian/rules updateconfigs
-bash: debian/rules: No such file or directory
it doesn't appear that there is a debian/rules file that exists.  Are you doing packaging of some sort?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Kernel/Compile - I try to get 1000HZ (/boot/config-...)
can you paste the result of ls -la from your current directory?
in the future, try to paste in the pastebin
Know what i have to do?
please pastebin the results of ls -la in that directory (pastebin is http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/212/plain/
you're trying to run debian/rules but there is no debian directory in your current directory
looks like you need to navigate to the directory where you extracted or downloaded the kernel source
locate debian gives no match..
ok, can you pastebin the contents of your current terminal so I can see all that you have done so far with this whole kernel compile?
also, no offense intended, but if you can't locate the file to run, you may want to reconsider compiling a new kernel until you understand the linux system and command line a little better..
I only want to change the HZ from 250 to 1000. Not recompil the kernel.. Thought i could do it with "debian/rules updateconfigs"-command.
you mean MHz?
No. I mean CONFIG_HZ=1000
I don't think I know what you're doing, or that you're aware of the possible and probably ramifications of changing the kernel configuration without knowing precisely what you're doing
what makes you think the 250 isn't the proper configuration?
all my other servers with 5.04 (this is 6.x) has 1000 HZ. 250 HZ gives me wrong FPS at counter-strike servers..
ok, well that makes sense, to change your kernel config is something I'm not experienced with on Ubuntu, and I'm afraid you have now stepped outside of my area of expertise, sorry
